title: How to Make a Simple Macrame and Accent Bracelet

steps.headline: Choose a central decoration (the owl here) and two accents (beads here).
steps.description: Cut 2 threads of pearl cotton 13-14 inch long and 1 thread 23-25 inch long

steps.headline: Tie one of the two short threads to one side and the other short thread to the other side of the central decoration.
Add the beads to each of the two threads, setting the beads between simple knots to secure their placement.
Make a double circle with the two crossing threads.
steps.description: Fold the long thread of the pearl cotton in half and tie approximately in the middle of the circle.

steps.headline: Start making macrame square knots.
steps.description: Put the left end under the two central threads to the right side. Put the right end under the left end, above the two central threads and into the loop on the left. Pull the ends to tie a knot.

steps.headline: Put the right end below the two central threads and leave it on the left side.
steps.description: Put the left end under the right thread, above the two central threads and into the loop on the left side. Pull the ends to tie a knot.

steps.headline: Remember to change the threads each time to make the square knot and continue braiding in this manner to make 1-1.5 inch of macrame square knots.
Make secure knots on the both ends of the central threads.
steps.description: They will serve as stops when you adjust the size of the handmade bracelet.

steps.headline: Neatly cut the loose ends left after braiding the square knots.
Wear your new bracelet with pride and pleasure.
steps.description: Invent new designs for other handmade bracelets and share them with your friends.

text: Choose a central decoration (the owl here) and two accents (beads here). Cut 2 threads of pearl cotton 13-14 inch long and 1 thread 23-25 inch long Tie one of the two short threads to one side and the other short thread to the other side of the central decoration. Make safe knots. Add the beads to each of the two threads, setting the beads between simple knots to secure their placement.  Make a double circle with the two crossing threads. Fold the long thread of the pearl cotton in half and tie approximately in the middle of the circle. Start making macrame square knots. Put the left end under the two central threads to the right side. Put the right end under the left end, above the two central threads and into the loop on the left. Pull the ends to tie a knot. Put the right end below the two central threads and leave it on the left side. Put the left end under the right thread, above the two central threads and into the loop on the left side. Pull the ends to tie a knot. Remember to change the threads each time to make the square knot and continue braiding in this manner to make 1-1.5 inch of macrame square knots.  Make secure knots on the both ends of the central threads. They will serve as stops when you adjust the size of the handmade bracelet. Neatly cut the loose ends left after braiding the square knots.  Wear your new bracelet with pride and pleasure. Invent new designs for other handmade bracelets and share them with your friends.
